'''Matt Zimmerman''' is a technologist and [[free software]] and [[open source]] developer. Matt is a well known developer in the [[Debian]] project, having occupied a role on the group's security team and maintained the [[Advanced Packaging Tool]] (APT).
'''Matt Zimmerman''' is a technologist and [[free software]] and [[open source]] developer. Matt is a well known developer in the [[Debian]] project, having occupied a role on the group's security team and maintained the [[Advanced Packaging Tool]] (APT).
â
Matt currently works for [[Canonical Ltd]]. as the technical leader of the [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]] project, chairman of the Ubuntu technical board and [[Chief technical officer|CTO]] of the project. At Canonical, Matt coordinates technological decisions related to the development and release of Ubuntu.
+
Matt currently works for [[Canonical Ltd]]. as the technical leader of the [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] project, chairman of the Ubuntu technical board and [[Chief technical officer|CTO]] of the project. At Canonical, Matt coordinates technological decisions related to the development and release of Ubuntu.
Matt is an alumnus of the [[Computer Science House]] at [[RIT]].
